title: Vital Signs API Routes
description:
Create REST API Routes for Vital Signs Monitoring with Clinical Validation

Implement a comprehensive set of RESTful API endpoints for managing patient vital signs data with built-in validation against medically-accepted normal ranges and configurable clinical alert thresholds.

Requirements:

API Endpoints:
- POST /api/vital-signs - Record new vital signs measurement
- GET /api/vital-signs/:patientId - Retrieve vital signs history for a patient
- GET /api/vital-signs/:patientId/latest - Get most recent vital signs
- GET /api/vital-signs/:id - Retrieve specific measurement by ID
- PUT /api/vital-signs/:id - Update existing measurement (with audit trail)
- DELETE /api/vital-signs/:id - Soft delete measurement

Vital Signs to Support:
- Heart rate (BPM)
- Blood pressure (systolic/diastolic in mmHg)
- Respiratory rate (breaths per minute)
- Temperature (Celsius/Fahrenheit)
- Oxygen saturation (SpO2 percentage)
- Blood glucose level (mg/dL or mmol/L)

Validation Layer:
- Define normal range boundaries for each vital sign (age-specific if applicable)
- Implement warning thresholds for abnormal but non-critical values
- Implement critical thresholds for values requiring immediate attention
- Reject measurements that fall outside physically possible ranges
- Return validation status with each measurement (normal/warning/critical)

Response Structure:
- Include measurement values with units
- Return validation status and applicable thresholds
- Provide timestamp and patient identifier
- Include any triggered alerts or flags

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Missing or incomplete vital sign data
- Out-of-range values that may indicate measurement errors
- Concurrent updates to the same patient's data
- Different unit systems (metric vs imperial)
- Pediatric vs adult normal ranges

Security & Compliance:
- Implement authentication and authorization
- Ensure HIPAA compliance for patient data handling
- Log all access and modifications with user attribution
- Validate input data types and sanitize against injection attacks

Testing Requirements:
- Unit tests for validation logic covering all threshold scenarios
- Integration tests for each API endpoint
- Test with boundary values for each vital sign
- Verify appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages
